availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Josephine E. Lynch (Louisville | Caroline Case, sister and neighbor of Levis)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Daughter of Jacob Stutsman and Mary Cox. Married Raymond Lynch in Jefferson County on May 6, 1849. Mother of Monroe Lynch, Raymond Bell Lynch, George J. Lynch, Mary A. Lynch, Belle Lynch, and Florence Lynch. Resident of Louisville in 1850. Resident of Louisville in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 396B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 12, p. 592A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Enumeraction District 141, p. 176C.
Find A Grave, "Josephine Stutsman Lynch (unknown-1898)," Memorial 171352256, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/171352256 (accessed December 4, 2019).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000819613, p. 220 of microfilm.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Frankfort, Kentucky, Roll 7007129: Jefferson County, Books 9-11, p. 451.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1955), KDLA, File #3534, Frankfort, Kentucky, Film 7016226: All Counties, p. 1532.
KYR-0001-004-0133.
